text: it doesn't matter where you stick the
needles it also doesn't matter if you
stick the needles what the evidence
shows is that acupuncture is essentially
an elaborate placebo you get a placebo
effect out of it and that is all you get
no specific effect out of the
acupuncture itself acupuncture which is
defined as inserting needles acupuncture
needles into acupuncture points that are
supposed to relate to the symptomatology
whatever symptoms you're trying to treat
the clinical research clearly shows
after literally thousands of studies
that it doesn't matter where you stick
the needles it also doesn't matter if
you stick the needles you could randomly
poke somebody with toothpicks and some
studies literally do that and that's
just as effective as doing all the
things that an acupuncturist is supposed
to do if they're equally effective what
does that mean I interpret that to mean
that acupuncture sticking needles and
acupuncture points doesn't work because
you don't have to do it you don't have
to stick the needle saying that
acupuncture works because there's a
there is a placebo effect would be like
a pharmaceutical company saying well our
drug and the placebo worked better than
no treatment at all in clinical trials
therefore both our drug and placebo work
it's not proper logic of science and
evidence it's not science-based medicine
the bottom line is and we have thousands
of studies now to demonstrate this
acupuncture doesn't work for any
indication
